definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to divine/to forecast or estimate/(of a place to live etc) to choose
Kara, city in northern Togo 多哥[Duo1 ge1]/Cara, Karla etc (name)
Kara, city in northern Togo 多哥[Duo1 ge1]/Cara, Karla etc (name)
Castro (name)/Fidel Castro or Fidel Alejandro Castro Ruz (1926-), Cuban revolutionary leader, prime minister 1959-1976, president 1976-2008
to issue a card/(slang) to reject a guy or a girl/to chuck

sentences.english: She visited her ‘former family’ in Katni regularly.
sentences.chinese: 他也定期與她的‘家人’在卡尼特會面。

sentences.english: The guske music is played on traditional string instrument.
sentences.chinese: 卡搜音樂是在傳統的管絃樂器上彈奏的。

sentences.english: I'm your Aunt Monica. Yes, I am.
sentences.chinese: 賓，我是你姑姑摩妮卡，沒錯。

sentences.english: To enhance the correctness of curtain, card, material and warrant.
sentences.chinese: 提高庫存料件的帳，卡，物和單證輸入的準確率。

sentences.english: Clean up any beads of mercury by using an index card and plastic dustpan.
sentences.chinese: 用撲索引卡和塑料簸箕清理水銀珠子。

sentences.english: Carmack said Id turned down many offers from large publishers over the years.
sentences.chinese: 卡馬克說號拒絕了許多優惠大出版商多年來。

sentences.english: May I have your passport and arrival card, please?
sentences.chinese: 請出示您的護照和入境卡？

sentences.english: Sex one-inch colour photos of the students are needed.
sentences.chinese: 需辦理接送卡的學生交家長一寸相片2張。

sentences.english: It offers 2 cosy rooms with a private balcony, a flat-screen TV and free Wi-Fi.
sentences.chinese: 酒店還爲客人提供免費停車卡和免費無線網絡連接。

sentences.english: Yes, this is my overseas travel accident insurance card.
sentences.chinese: 是的，這就是我國外旅行意外保險卡。

sentences.english: Charaka also knew the fundamentals of genetics.
sentences.chinese: 查拉卡也知道遺傳學的基本原理。

sentences.english: People “have got money in their hand if they’ve got a gift card,” Mr. Ullman said.
sentences.chinese: 人們“只要受到禮品卡就會有錢”Ullman說。

sentences.english: This card can enable you to watch movies for free in this cinema.
sentences.chinese: 有了這張卡，你就可以在這家影院免費看電影。

sentences.english: Last month I talked about how to write a device driver for radio-tuner cards.
sentences.chinese: 上個月我講述了怎樣爲音頻接收卡編寫設備驅動。

sentences.english: The first identity cards are expected to be issued in about 18months.
sentences.chinese: 第一張該類型身份卡預計在未來18個月內將被髮布。

sentences.english: Lizzy wants to join the school library.
sentences.chinese: 莉齊想辦這個學校圖書館的借書卡。

definition: to click (using a mouse or other pointing device)
to go online/to put sth online
best of the best/collection of the best (of sth)
to hit/to press/to strike (on the keyboard)/to click (a web page button)
to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
Chenggong or Chengkung town in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
